SECOND AND ENLARGED EDITION NOW READY
COTSWORTH'S DIRECT CALCULATOR. Series
“O.R.” Bound full Leather, 45s. Including Reciprocal Tables from
1 to 10,000,000.
This work contains over 1,000,000 distinct results and is used for making calculations of
MULTIPLICATION, DIVISION, AVERAGE, PERCENTAGE, INTEREST, EXCHANGE,
SQUARE and CUBE ROOT, and General and Scientific Calculations of all combinations of numbers.
Multiplication of any three figures by any other three figures from 1 to 1,000
Is seen at a glance. Larger numbers being easily worked in groups of three figures.

THE
ENGLISH CATALOGUE
OF BOOKS WITH INDICES
Special Offer to the Trade, Librarians
and Others
THE PUBLISHERS' CIRCULAR and the
CATALOGUES connected with it having become the property of a NEW COMPANY
(embracing in its Directorate the names of some of its original founders nearly seventy
years ago), the Directors have decided to make an exceptional offer of the present
small stock of Catalogues. Accordingly they have fixed the price so low that no one
interested in the literature of the Victorian Era of the past century, no Bookseller,
Publisher, Author or Librarian need be without a set so far as they can now be supplied.
The First Volume of the English Catalogue, from 1835 to 1862, and its
accompanying Index Volume are out of print and scarce.
The Second Volume, 1863 to 1871 inclusive, is also out of print and scarce.
loloonnoo
The following are the Volumes which are now available :-
Yolume II. THE INDEX OF SUBJECTS only. Contains the years 1856 to 1875 inclusive.
N.B.-It contains 1856 to 1873 in one alphabet and 1874 and 1875 in separate alphabets (including 20 years),
thus forming a reasonable substitute for part of the out of print Vol. I. and the whole of Vol. Il.
It supplies Titles under Subject, and price and year.

The above seven Volumes, originally published at FIFTEEN POUNDS, can now be had newly bound in
half morocco in Five Volumes for SIX POUNDS, or in sheets for FIVE POUNDS.
If separate Volumes are required, they can be supplied at the following prices :
Vol II., sells 429., now offered for 159. Vol. V., sells 84s.,

.
It should always be remembered that these Volumes will never become out of
date or useless. The total number of them is always diminishing, and when they are
all out of print there will no longer be obtainable any complete consecutive Catalogue
at all of the English Books published during the Victorian Era (1837 to 1900). The
Official British Museum Catalogues covering the same period are altogether too costly
and cumbersome for ordinary persons or purses.

## p. 5 (#11) ###############################################

PREFATORY NOTE
This seventy-first yearly issue of the English Catalogue of Books comprises the
titles (in duplicate-namely, under author, and subject or title) of works published
during 1907, and also of some received too late for inclusion in the seventieth issue.
The main entry of each book begins with the author's surname (if known) in
heavy type. As an index to these “Author" records, entries are also made under
the titles, commencing with the most important word (which usually indicates the
subject dealt with by each book), or with the first word; the word or name under
which the main entry appears is printed in italics in these index entries, thus giving
a reference to the place where the fullest information about a book may be found.
Main entries and index are in one alphabet.
The publications of Learned Societies are recorded in an Appendix.
The names and addresses of the publishers of Great Britain and Ireland will be
found at the end of the volume, followed by those of the principal publishers in the
United States and in Canada. The telegraph and cable addresses and telephone
numbers have been added when known.
A brief historical note on the development of the English Catalogue, and an
analysis of the books of this year, follow the preface.
Hearty thanks are due to many publishers, secretaries, authors, and biblio-
graphers who have assisted in making this book more correct and comprehensive
than it otherwise would have been.
The Editor will be glad to have particulars of author, price, publisher, and
month of publication of any work which may have been omitted. Information as
to each book should be given on a separate slip of paper or postcard. It should be
addressed to
The Editor of Tbe Englisb Catalogue of Books,
“ Publishers' Circular" Office,
St. Dunstan's House, Fetter Lane,
London, E.C.
January, 1908,

In addition to Articles and Notes and Announcements of

in the last issue of each month.

and “For Sale" appear in “The Publishers' Circular" each week.

THE ENGLISH CATALOGUE
;
DIRECTORY OF PUBLISHERS
Publishers have been invited to send us their Telegraphic Addresses and Telephone Numbers.
Those sent will be found below between square brackets [ ], and separated from each other by a semicolon (;)
This list of Publishers, with their Addresses, has been principally compiled with a view to supplying
information regarding the books in the 1907 English Catalogue. This will explain the inclusion of many
firms in the list who can scarcely, in the strict acceptation of the term, be called Publishers, since the publication
of books forms only an occasional portion of their business.
